00020 /*****************************************************************************
00021 
00022   sc_int.h -- A signed integer whose length is less than 64 bits.
00023 
00024               Unlike arbitrary precision, arithmetic and bitwise operations
00025               are performed using the native types (hence capped at 64 bits).
00026               The sc_int integer is useful when the user does not need
00027               arbitrary precision and the performance is superior to
00028               sc_bigint/sc_biguint.
00029 
00030   Original Author: Amit Rao, Synopsys, Inc.
00031 
00032  *****************************************************************************/
00033 
00034 /*****************************************************************************
00035 
00036   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00037   changes you are making here.
00038 
00039       Name, Affiliation, Date: Ali Dasdan, Synopsys, Inc.
00040   Description of Modification: - Resolved ambiguity with sc_(un)signed.
00041                                - Merged the code for 64- and 32-bit versions
00042                                  via the constants in sc_nbdefs.h.
00043                                - Eliminated redundant file inclusions.
00044     
00045       Name, Affiliation, Date:
00046   Description of Modification:
00047 
00048  *****************************************************************************/
00049

00062 #ifndef SC_INT_H
00063 #define SC_INT_H

00065

00069 namespace sc_dt

00072 // classes defined in this module
00073 template <int W> class sc_int;
00074 
00075 
00076 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00077 //  CLASS TEMPLATE : sc_int<W>
00078 //
00079 //  Template class sc_int<W> is the interface that the user sees. It is
00080 //  derived from sc_int_base and most of its methods are just wrappers
00081 //  that call the corresponding method in the parent class. Note that
00082 //  the length of sc_int datatype is specified as a template parameter.
00083 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 
00085 template <int W>
00086 class sc_int
00087     : public sc_int_base
00088 {
00089 public:
00090 
00091     // constructors
00092 
00093     sc_int()
00094         : sc_int_base( W )
00095         {}
00096 
00097     sc_int( int_type v )
00098         : sc_int_base( v, W )
00099         {}
00100 
00101     sc_int( const sc_int<W>& a )
00102         : sc_int_base( a )
00103         {}
00104 
00105     sc_int( const sc_int_base& a )
00106         : sc_int_base( W )
00107         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a ); }
00108 
00109     sc_int( const sc_int_subref_r& a )
00110         : sc_int_base( W )
00111         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a ); }
00112 
00113     template< class T >
00114     sc_int( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
00115         : sc_int_base( W )
00116         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a->to_int64() ); }
00117 
00118     sc_int( const sc_signed& a )
00119         : sc_int_base( W )
00120         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a ); }
00121 
00122     sc_int( const sc_unsigned& a )
00123         : sc_int_base( W )
00124         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a ); }

00186         { sc_int_base::operator = ( v ); return *this; }
00187 
00188     sc_int<W>& operator = ( const sc_int_base& a )
00189         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a ); return *this; }
00190 
00191     sc_int<W>& operator = ( const sc_int_subref_r& a )
00192         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a ); return *this; }
00193 
00194     sc_int<W>& operator = ( const sc_int<W>& a )
00195         { m_val = a.m_val; return *this; }
00196 
00197     template< class T >
00198     sc_int<W>& operator = ( const sc_generic_base<T>& a )
00199         { sc_int_base::operator = ( a->to_int64() ); return *this; }
00200 
00201     sc_int<W>& operator = ( const sc_signed& a )

00275         { sc_int_base::operator |= ( v ); return *this; }

00280 
00281     sc_int<W>& operator <<= ( int_type v )
00282         { sc_int_base::operator <<= ( v ); return *this; }
00283

00285         { sc_int_base::operator >>= ( v ); return *this; }
00286 
00287 
00288     // prefix and postfix increment and decrement operators
00289 
00290     sc_int<W>& operator ++ () // prefix
00291         { sc_int_base::operator ++ (); return *this; }
00292 
00293     const sc_int<W> operator ++ ( int ) // postfix
00294         { return sc_int<W>( sc_int_base::operator ++ ( 0 ) ); }
00295 
00296     sc_int<W>& operator -- () // prefix
00297         { sc_int_base::operator -- (); return *this; }
00298 
00299     const sc_int<W> operator -- ( int ) // postfix
00300         { return sc_int<W>( sc_int_base::operator -- ( 0 ) ); }
00301 };
